result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott R. Munsch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Distribute Recording of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)3.
  • Invade Privacy - Use Surveillance Device, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 942.08(2)(a).
  • Invade Privacy - Use Surveillance Device, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 942.08(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant is to have NO CONTACT with: K. Freese, L.R.F, J. Wisner, and/or B. Freese. Defendant is not to have contact with any females under the age of 18 years of age without agent approval.

Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.   Defendant to comply with the Sex Offender Registration Program under Wis. Stat. 301.45 &  973.048(3).  Complete a Sex Offender Treatment Assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the Supervising Agent.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

records.addlTxt:
9:07 am case called. Defendant Scott R. Munsch in court with attorney Raymond l Edelstein.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PSI reviewed-corrections and clarifications will be made during sentencing arguments. Chapter 950 addressed-will have two statements. Attorney Edelstein makes statement regarding court's determination regarding Chapter 950 standing. Statement by J. Wisner. Statement by K. Freese. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Attorney Edelstein. Statement by defendant. Court makes statement prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to: COUNT 1- SWD and places on probation for a period of 3 years. CONDITIONS: CONDITIONS: No Contact with K. Freese,  L.R.F., J. Wisner, and/or B. Freese, AODA and follow through. No Contact with any females under the age of 18 years without agent approval. Sex Offender Treatment and Sex Offender Registry. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA Sample and Surcharge to be assessed and provided. Court admonishes defendant regarding expungment of DNA. Appeal Rights Given. 
Count 2 & 3- COUNT 2-9 months WCJ with Huber and Good Time Credit. No Credit for Time served. Sentence to begin no later than April 28, 2017. COUNT 3-3 months WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. No Credit for Time Served. Consecutive to each other. To begin no later than April 28, 2017. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.  DNA Sample and Surcharge to be assessed and provided. Court admonishes defendant regarding expungment of DNA. Appeal Rights Given.
from Judge Dutcher, Dated 2/20/2016 Re: Chapter 950 Issues at Sentencing
from ADA Anderson, Dated 2/13/17 Re: Chapter 950 Issues at Sentencing

11:02 am case called. Defendant Scott R. Munsch in court with attorney Raymond l Edelstein.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended information filed by ADA Anderson. Court accepts amended information. Discussion between court and counsel regarding statute of limitations to Counts 2 & 3. Waived through coliquy and plea questionnaire. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant. Sex offender registry addressed-discretionary offense.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1, Count 2, & Count 3 of the Amended Information.  PSI requested by defense. Court accepts plea and orders a PSI to be completed. SEH previously scheduled for February 28, 2017 at 9:00 am. Court admonishes defendant regarding bond remaining in effect until sentencing and implications for agreement as previously stated on the record by the State if bond were to be violated.

Plea hearing on December 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on February 28, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.  No contact with any females under the age of 18 years of age unless in the presence of a parent or guardian.

Court questions counsel. Statement by Attorney Edelstein regarding stipulation. Statement by Attorney Anderson.  Bond modification request by ADA Anderson. Statement by Attorney Edelstein regarding request for bond modification.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 28, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Case Called @ 9:03 AM: Defendant Scott R. Munsch in court with attorney Raymond l Edelstein.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prior to going of record Court has reviewed Ex No 1 - counsel agree to the marking of Ex No 1.  Investigator Greg Weitz sworn in for testimony.  Direct Exam by ADA Anderson.  Witness confirms content of Ex No 1 and process of transfer thru Hygiene Lab.  State moves for admission of Ex No 1 and Court receives same.  Record to reflect positive ID made of Def by Witness. Cross Exam by Atty Edelstein.  Re-Direct by ADA Anderson.  Re-Cross Exam by Atty Edelstein.  Exam by Court.  Argument by ADA Anderson.  Argument by Atty Edelstein.  Further argument by ADA Anderson.  Further argument by Atty Edelstein.  The Court:  Finds probable cause exists and Def BOT.  ARGN Scheduled.  Arraignment scheduled for July 29, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Exhibit No 1 for Preliminary Hearing on June 30, 2016 - Sealed by the Court
Preliminary hearing on June 30, 2016 at 09:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Raymond l Edelstein in court, appearing in person.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pre-Lim requested and scheduled.  Court to review CD of 3 alleged recordings prior to Pre-Lim Hrg.  State to submit in the same manner as a Squad Video and to be marked as Ex No 1 and review prior to hearing.  Court directs that it be kept in file under seal and will be utilized at pre-lim hearing.  Based upon contact and pending charges will be kept under seal to protect victims and sanctity of this proceeding.  Duplicate CD to be provided to the Court and marked as an Exhibit.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on June 3, 2016 at 02:10 pm.

Case called @ 3:15 p.m. Defendant Scott R. Munsch in court with attorney Raymond l Edelstein both appearing telephonically.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Edelstein - video has been viewed by the defense but no further discussions have taken place regarding resolution. Requesting another STC.  Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 02:10 pm.
from DA's Office - Video requested by defense has not yet been reproduced by the crime lab - the Court will address at the 4/25 STC if the problem has not been resolved by that time
Status conference at 04-25-2016 03:05 pm

Case called @ 3:47 p.m. Defendant Scott R. Munsch in court with attorney Raymond l Edelstein both appearing telephonically.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to compel discovery filed by Atty Edelstein. DA Blader - 8mm cassette tape may be duplicated by the crime lab and possibly be put onto a DVD. The question is whether the tape can be reproduced as the footage contains a juvenile. Statement by Atty Edelstein - believes he is entitled to the video as it is discovery. DA Blader - the State is prohibited from reproducing and distributing footage that can be construed as child pornography.  The Court questions whether the tape can be viewed by Atty Edelstein and his client at a location the would not violate attorney/client privilege. The Court directs that the State Crime Lab reproduce the contraband to a DVD or the like and will be retained only by the DA's Office. Attorney Edelstein to then be provided without any limitation the information that has been reproduced at a location that does not violate attorney/client privilege. The Court does not find at this time that there is a need for dissemination of the information - the issue is not the reproduction it is the distribution. The court orders that the video by reproduced and available by no later than April 1, 2016. Atty Edelstein to have opportunity to review the information by no later than April 15, 2016.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 03:05 pm.
Motion hearing at 02-15-2016 03:45 pm

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:03 PM: Defendant Scott R. Munsch in court with attorney Raymond l Edelstein.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  ADA argues as to bond - $5000 Signature Bond w/conditions.  Argument by Atty Edelstein as to bond request of the State.  Further argument as to bond conditions requested.  The Court: Orders $5000 Signature Bond with conditions.   Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Counsel does not have an issue with Judge Dutcher remaining as judge of record.  Status conference scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 11:15 am.
